Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

REST API repository Humans¶

async src.repository.humans.create_human(body: HumanModel, user: User, db: Session) → Human¶

The create_human function creates a new human in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – HumanModel: Create a new human object

  • user – User: Get the user who is making the request

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A human object

async src.repository.humans.get_human(human_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Human¶

The get_human function returns a human object from the database.

Parameters:

  • human_id – int: Get the human from the database

  • user – User: Get the user that is making the request

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A single human object

async src.repository.humans.get_human_email(human_email: str, user: User, db: Session) → List[Human]¶

The get_human_email function takes in a human_email and user, and returns all humans with that email.

Parameters:

  • human_email – str: Filter the query by email

  • user – User: Get the user id from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of humans

async src.repository.humans.get_human_name(human_name: str, user: User, db: Session) → List[Human]¶

The get_human_name function takes in a human name and returns all humans with that name.

Parameters:

  • human_name – str: Filter the database by name

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the user object

  • db – Session: Create a database session

Returns:

A list of humans

async src.repository.humans.get_human_surname(human_surname: str, user: User, db: Session) → List[Human]¶
The get_human_surname function returns a list of humans with the given surname.
Args:

human_surname (str): The surname of the human to be returned. user (User): The user who is making this request. This is used for authorization purposes, as only users can access their own data in this application. db (Session): A database session object that allows us to query and manipulate our database objects without having to create new sessions each time we want to do so.

Parameters:

  • human_surname – str: Filter the results by surname

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the database

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A list of all humans with the given surname

async src.repository.humans.get_humans(limit: int, offset: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Human]¶

The get_humans function returns a list of humans from the database.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the database

  • db – Session: Create a database session

Returns:

A list of humans

async src.repository.humans.get_list_birthdays(user: User, db: Session) → List[Human]¶

The get_list_birthdays function returns a list of humans whose birthday is in the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the database

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A list of humans whose birthday is in the next 7 days

async src.repository.humans.remove_human(human_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Human | None¶
The remove_human function removes a human from the database.
Args:

human_id (int): The id of the human to remove. user (User): The user who is removing this human.

Parameters:

  • human_id – int: Specify the id of the human to be removed

  • user – User: Identify the user who is making the request

  • db – Session: Connect to the database

Returns:

The human object that was deleted

async src.repository.humans.update_human(body: HumanModel, human_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Human | None¶
The update_human function updates a human in the database.
Args:

body (HumanModel): The HumanModel object to be updated. human_id (int): The id of the Human to be updated. user (User): The User who is updating this Human, used for authorization purposes.

Parameters:

  • body – HumanModel: Get the data from the request body

  • human_id – int: Find the human in the database

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A human object

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email address of the user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Create a database session

Returns:

A user object

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user associated with that email. If no such user exists, it will return None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass in the email of the user we want to get from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The first user in the database with a matching email

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that is expected to be passed in

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A user object

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Specify the type of user

  • token – str | None: Pass the refresh token to the update_token function

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

None
